definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: All of them trace their origins to the Golden Age of Muslim civilization.
sentences.chinese: 答案是，它们都可以追溯到伊斯兰文明的黄金时代。

sentences.english: The golden age of Australia are the only designated health club Reiter training institute.
sentences.chinese: 是黄金时代澳瑞特健身俱乐部唯一指定培训机构。

sentences.english: We live today in a golden age.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天生活在黄金时代。

sentences.english: This is looking more and more like a golden age of exoplanet discovery.
sentences.chinese: 这看起来越来越象一个探索系外行星的黄金时代。

sentences.english: Tang Poetry is the golden age of the development of China's poetry .
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道唐代时我国诗歌发展的黄金时代。

sentences.english: A shiny new era is tiptoeing nearer.
sentences.chinese: 一个闪耀的世纪的黄金时代在接近。

sentences.english: This was the golden age for tea production in Mucha.
sentences.chinese: 这是木栅种茶的黄金时代。

sentences.english: They were the only tears, except my own, I ever saw in that Golden Age .
sentences.chinese: 我除了自己，在黄金时代只看到她流过泪。

sentences.english: During the Golden Age the ceiling of the Parthenon was painted red, gold, and blue.
sentences.chinese: 在黄金时代，巴台农庙的房顶是漆成红蓝和金色的。

sentences.english: For Swift the golden age was that of the great Elizabethans.
sentences.chinese: 对斯威夫特来说，黄金时代是伟大的伊丽莎白时代。

sentences.english: After all, the golden age of Arab civilization ended in the 13th century.
sentences.chinese: 要知道，阿拉伯文明的黄金时代在13世纪就已终结。

sentences.english: It hearkened back to a, to a golden time.
sentences.chinese: 它唤回了一个黄金时代。

sentences.english: So some are starting to predict a golden era for North-East Asian security.
sentences.chinese: 因此一些人开始预言东北亚安全的黄金时代将要来临。

sentences.english: The carved printing stepped into its"golden age"in Song Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 有宋一代，我国雕版印刷进入其黄金时代。

sentences.english: Period was a golden age of Chinese ideology.
sentences.chinese: 春秋战国时期是中国思想史的黄金时代。

sentences.english: The Silver Age came next, inferior to the golden.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的是逊于黄金时代的白银时代。

definition: Brave New World, novel by Aldous Huxley 阿道司·赫胥黎[A1 dao4 si1 · He4 xu1 li2]
flourishing age (of the ceremonial tripod)/golden age
A Tale of Two Cities by Charles Dickens 查爾斯·狄更斯|查尔斯·狄更斯[Cha2 er3 si1 · Di2 geng1 si1]
a decade of a century (e.g. the Sixties)/age/era/period/CL:個|个[ge4]
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
